sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"生动的"之意。
means: vivid ： 普通用词，侧重有强烈的实际感或逼真感，使人富于想象或留下深刻的印象。
lively ： 普通用词，与vivid可通用。
pictorial ： 强调产生或制造生动的效果。
picturesque ： 既指景色、人物等犹如图画般美丽，又可指文艺作品的风格绚丽多彩，尤指一种原始粗犷的美。

sentence.Network_en: Overcooked greens are my most vivid recollection of school dinners.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我对学校午餐的回忆中，印象最深刻的就是蔬菜总是炒过头。

sentence.Network_en: He relied on translucent enamels to produce vivid, glowing pictures.
sentence.Network_cn: 他利用半透明瓷漆绘制出鲜艳生动的图画。

sentence.Network_en: Vivid red and pink geraniums cascade over my balcony.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲜艳的红色和粉色的天竺葵从我家的阳台上直挂下去。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin vividus, from vivere 'to live'

entry.tran: （记忆、描述等）生动的,逼真的,清晰的
entry.def: If you describe memories and descriptions as vivid, you mean that they are very clear and detailed.

example.ex: People of my generation who lived through World War II have vivid memories of confusion and incompetence...
example.tran: 我们这一代经历过二战的人都真切地记得当时的迷惘和无助。

example.ex: On Wednesday night  I had a very vivid dream which really upset me.
example.tran: 周三晚上，我做了个十分逼真的梦，让我很不安。

entry.def: Something that is vivid is very bright in colour.

means.word_mean: 1. evoking lifelike images within the mind;
2. having the clarity and freshness of immediate experience;

auth_sentence.content: The world seems to sparkle and colours look vivid.
auth_sentence.res_content: The world seems to sparkle and colours look vivid.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The world seems to sparkle and colours look vivid.

auth_sentence.content: One vivid memory stayed with me all these years.
auth_sentence.res_content: One vivid memory stayed with me all these years.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One vivid memory stayed with me all these years.

auth_sentence.content: La Familia was doing some vivid social messaging there.
auth_sentence.res_content: La Familia was doing some vivid social messaging there.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: La Familia was doing some vivid social messaging there.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+viv生命+ial……的→共同活跃的→欢乐的
vi=viv生命+able能……的→adj.可行的,能活下去的
viv生命+acious多……的→多生命的→活泼的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 鲜艳的;生动的,栩栩如生的
stems_affixes.word_buile: viv生命+id……的→adj.鲜艳的;生动的,栩栩如生的
revive[v.恢复;[使]复苏]+al表名词→n.复苏,再生
survive幸免于+al状态→经过事故活着→幸存
sur超过+viv生命+e→活下来了→幸免于

Sentence.sentence: By introducing a degree of forcefulness and humor, the machine could be presented as a vivid and unique character.
By introducing a degree of forefulness and humour, the machine could be presented as a vivid and unique character

means.word_mean: (光、颜色等)鲜艳的耀眼的,鲜艳的,强烈的

sentences.en: Her dress was a vivid colour.

means.word_mean: 生动的, 栩栩如生的

sentences.en: A vivid picture is present to our eye.
sentences.cn: 一幅栩栩如生的画面出现在我们眼前。

sentences.en: Our economic construction is vivid with life.
sentences.cn: 我们的经济建设生气勃勃。

jushi.english: The word is added to give vivider description.
jushi.chinese: 增加这个词会使其描写更加生动。

jushi.english: Clare was the most vivid member of the family.
jushi.chinese: 克莱尔是这一家中最活跃的成员。

jushi.english: Her dress was a vivid color.
